metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9795 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability where type-confusion in the IonMonkey just-in-time (JIT) compiler could potentially be used by malicious JavaScript to trigger a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.6, Firefox ESR < 60.6, and Firefox < 66.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
